{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332344,"name":"Justin | 6925 Alumentor","username":"BTYWAR","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/btywar/{size}/191771_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T20:36:09.935Z","cooked":"

Hello, I seem to be running to an issue with swerve. When I try and drive the robot forward, it goes sideways and when we try and drive the robot to the right, it goes to the left. Does anyone know why? The code is here. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T20:36:09.935Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":67,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":364.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458573,"topic_slug":"robot-controls-inverse","display_username":"Justin | 6925 Alumentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/BTYWAR/6925-Crescendo","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - BTYWAR/6925-Crescendo","clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56061,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-controls-inverse/458573/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3332443,"name":"","username":"Crafter","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/77aa72/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T21:53:37.157Z","cooked":"

Are you using field relative swerve? If so, then you should make sure your gyro is zeroed correctly.

Our programmer noticed the same issue in our autonomous, apparently the sample code he based ours off of had the x and y axis flipped, meaning y would be going “sideways” and x would be “forwards/backwards”. I would double check that with your code as well

Yes, we are using field relative swerve. We did zero the gyro correctly to my knowledge.

I double checked that and it seems fine. We also just noticed that if we physically rotate the robot 180 degrees, it fixes everything. However we want it to work so that we do not have to rotate it 180 to make autonomous easier. We have also tried rotating pidgeon 180, we tried changing from blue alliance to red alliance, all of which did not solve the issue.

It sounds like your gyro may be flipped. Can you verify its value increases when rotating the way you expect? Typically you want the gyro to increase when going ccw, and decrease when going cw, but that depends partially on your code.

Is the gyro the pigeon? How do I find its value?

Yes, the pigeon is the gyro.
You could put the value on the dashboard by calling SmartDashboard.putNumber with gryo.getYaw

in my team’s robt, when i have turned the Pigeon sideways, it did not work. I think it is because of quadrature calculations with the magnetometer (too complicated)

the best solution i think, it is to set the initial yaw of the pigeon as 90° or 270° (the one that works) in your SwerveSubsys() Class.

for the turning left to right, if the gyro tunning does not work, i think you can invert the axis of the controller on the robot container, or inverting the X axis in your void drive() at the swerveSubsys class ass follows:

 public void drive(Translation2d translation, double rotation, boolean fieldRelative, boolean isOpenLoop) {
        SwerveModuleState[] swerveModuleStates =
            Constants.Swerve.swerveKinematics.toSwerveModuleStates(
                fieldRelative ? ChassisSpeeds.fromFieldRelativeSpeeds(
                                    translation.getX(), 
                                    translation.getY(), 
                                    rotation, 
                                    getHeading()
                                )
                                : new ChassisSpeeds(
                                    -translation.getX(), //axis inverted
                                    translation.getY(), //maybe is this axis, but left and right is generally X
                                    rotation)
                                );
